alert.note: Alert for Duplin; Lenoir (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 31 at 4:55AM EDT until August 31 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Newport/Morehead City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Duplin County in eastern North Carolina... Lenoir County in eastern North Carolina... * Until 800 AM EDT. * At 455 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Recent heavy rainfall in these locations will result in increased runoff and a rapid onset to flooding. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kinston, La Grange, Mount Olive, Grifton, Kornegay, Deep Run, Beautancus, Institute, Dawson, Graingers, Albertson, Kinston Regional Jetport, Faison, Pink Hill, Calypso and Sandy Bottom. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
